contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Amagase'''|天瀬町|Amagase-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Hita District, Ōita|Hita District]], [[Ōita Prefecture|Ōita]], [[Japan]]. On March 22, 2005 Amagase, along with the town of [[Ōyama, Ōita|Ōyama]], and the villages of [[Kamitsue, Ōita|Kamitsue]], [[Maetsue, Ōita|Maetsue]] and [[Nakatsue, Ōita|Nakatsue]], all from [[Hita District, Ōita|Hita District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Hita, Ōita|Hita]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 6,295 and the [[population density|density]] of 61.82 persons per km². The total area was 101.83 km². {{DEFAULTSORT:Amagase, Oita}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ōita Prefecture]] {{Oita-geo-stub}}
